bug.author: oussamasf
bug.description:
when i call " get_landmarks_from_directory" i get this error get_landmarks_from_directory <denchmark-code>/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/face_alignment/detection/sfd/detect.py in batch_detect(net, img_batch, device) 43 olist = [oelem.data.cpu().numpy() for oelem in olist] 44 ---> 45 bboxlists = get_predictions(List(olist), batch_size) 46 return bboxlists 47
TypeError: __init__() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given </denchmark-code>
despite that i respected the doc instructions but still have same problem

comments.comment:
when i call " get_landmarks_from_directory" i get this error get_landmarks_from_directory /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/face_alignment/detection/sfd/detect.py in batch_detect(net, img_batch, device) 43 olist = [oelem.data.cpu().numpy() for oelem in olist] 44 ---> 45 bboxlists = get_predictions(List(olist), batch_size) 46 return bboxlists 47
TypeError: __init__() takes 1 positional argument but 2 were given
despite that i respected the doc instructions but still have same problem
I was trying on my computer, but I couldn't manage to import the face_alignment library. Then when I migrate to Google Colab, I faced the same issue.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ekinim>@ekinim</denchmark-link> what version of pytorch are you using? The minimum supported one is 1.5.x.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/oussamasf>@oussamasf</denchmark-link> could you try installing it from source please?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/oussamasf>@oussamasf</denchmark-link> thanks for the info, can you try installing the package directly from github source? It should be fixed now
the problem is fixed ,thank you so much !

@oussamasf thanks for the info, can you try installing the package directly from github source? It should be fixed now
Thank you Adrian, problem fixed. You are so kind and diligent.
